intro: Espeletia lopezii var. escobalensis, commonly known as the Escobalensis heather, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and hairy, gray-green foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flower heads that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in páramo ecosystems, where it is adapted to cool, moist conditions. This variant is notable for its ornamental value and ecological significance in its native habitat.
